availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Wirt Rowlett (Henry County resident; corp & QM sgt 2nd Ky Cav U.S.A., 27th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Owen County, Kentucky, native. Resident of Henry County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal and quartermaster sergeant from September 9, 1861, to February 6, 1864. Clerk in 1864. Mustered into the 27th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on March 7, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 307.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Lockport, p. 314A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0021.
Find A Grave, "William Wirt Rowlett (1845-1904)," Memorial #72780618, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72780618 (accessed September 3, 2020).
